Description: Two joined fragments (shoulder and body, one handle) of glass amphoriskos.Body clear brown (?), opaque light blue and opaque orange trails; straight shoulder, sloping down to curved junction with body; elongated ovoid body with slightly convex sides tapering downward. Small vertical ribbon-handle at top of body. On body a feather pattern of three mingled colours, bounded above and below by a white horizontal trail. On handle, vertically, a light blue trail, bounded on each side by a white and an orange trail. Core-formed and tooled; trails on neck and body drawn on, marvered and combed, those on handles in sunken relief.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Hala Sultan Tekke, Uncertain tomb
Curator's comments: [From BM glass catalogue: Bailey 1976, 28, pi. xxxvii, g. For analysis of the remains of the core of this vessel see p. 24, citing Bimson and Werner 1969,264if., and idd. 1970,121ff]
Bibliographic references: Glass / Catalogue of Greek and Roman Glass in the British Museum (3)
Peltenburg 1986 / Ramesside Egypt and Cyprus (p. 152, Bottle no. 8)
Jacobsson 1994 / Aegyptiaca from Late Bronze Age Cyprus (No. 99)
Bailey 1976 / The British Museum excavations at Hala Sultan Tekke in 1897 and 1898 (p. 28 and pl. XXXVIIg)
